data.price: After his death, We did not send down any soldiers from heaven against his people, nor did We have to do so.
data.arabic: ۞ وَمَآ أَنزَلۡنَا عَلَىٰ قَوۡمِهِۦ مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِۦ مِن جُندٖ مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا كُنَّا مُنزِلِينَ

data.price: It was no more than a single blast, and immediately they were extinguished.
data.arabic: إِن كَانَتۡ إِلَّا صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ فَإِذَا هُمۡ خَٰمِدُونَ

data.price: Alas for the humans! No messenger ever comes to them but they ridicule him.
data.arabic: يَٰحَسۡرَةً عَلَى ٱلۡعِبَادِۚ مَا يَأۡتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ

data.price: Do they not see how many generations We destroyed before them who will never come back to them[8]?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ كَمۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَا قَبۡلَهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡقُرُونِ أَنَّهُمۡ إِلَيۡهِمۡ لَا يَرۡجِعُونَ
data.footnotes: [8] i.e., to the life of this world.

data.price: Yet all of them will be brought before Us.
data.arabic: وَإِن كُلّٞ لَّمَّا جَمِيعٞ لَّدَيۡنَا مُحۡضَرُونَ

data.price: There is a sign for them in the dead land: We give it life and produce from it grain for them to eat.
data.arabic: وَءَايَةٞ لَّهُمُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ ٱلۡمَيۡتَةُ أَحۡيَيۡنَٰهَا وَأَخۡرَجۡنَا مِنۡهَا حَبّٗا فَمِنۡهُ يَأۡكُلُونَ

data.price: And We have made therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines, and caused springs to gush forth,
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا فِيهَا جَنَّٰتٖ مِّن نَّخِيلٖ وَأَعۡنَٰبٖ وَفَجَّرۡنَا فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلۡعُيُونِ

data.price: so that they may eat of its fruit that was not made by their hands[9]. Will they not then give thanks?
data.arabic: لِيَأۡكُلُواْ مِن ثَمَرِهِۦ وَمَا عَمِلَتۡهُ أَيۡدِيهِمۡۚ أَفَلَا يَشۡكُرُونَ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e., that which Allah has produced for them without labor on their part.

data.price: Glory be to the One Who created all types of things[10] that the earth produces, and of themselves, and of things that they have no knowledge about.
data.arabic: سُبۡحَٰنَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلۡأَزۡوَٰجَ كُلَّهَا مِمَّا تُنۢبِتُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَمِنۡ أَنفُسِهِمۡ وَمِمَّا لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., all species, all things in pairs.

data.price: There is another sign for them in the night: We strip from it the daylight, and they are left in darkness.
data.arabic: وَءَايَةٞ لَّهُمُ ٱلَّيۡلُ نَسۡلَخُ مِنۡهُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فَإِذَا هُم مُّظۡلِمُونَ

data.price: The sun is running to its determined course. That is the design of the All-Mighty, All-Knowing.
data.arabic: وَٱلشَّمۡسُ تَجۡرِي لِمُسۡتَقَرّٖ لَّهَاۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَقۡدِيرُ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلۡعَلِيمِ

data.price: As for the moon, We have determined phases for it, until it becomes like an old palm stalk.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡقَمَرَ قَدَّرۡنَٰهُ مَنَازِلَ حَتَّىٰ عَادَ كَٱلۡعُرۡجُونِ ٱلۡقَدِيمِ

data.price: It is not for the sun to catch up with the moon, nor for the night to outstrip the day. Each is floating in its own orbit.
data.arabic: لَا ٱلشَّمۡسُ يَنۢبَغِي لَهَآ أَن تُدۡرِكَ ٱلۡقَمَرَ وَلَا ٱلَّيۡلُ سَابِقُ ٱلنَّهَارِۚ وَكُلّٞ فِي فَلَكٖ يَسۡبَحُونَ

data.price: Another sign for them is that We carried their offspring[11] in the loaded Ark,
data.arabic: وَءَايَةٞ لَّهُمۡ أَنَّا حَمَلۡنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡفُلۡكِ ٱلۡمَشۡحُونِ
data.footnotes: [11] "Dhurriyyah" (lit., offspring); however, it is used here to denote ancestors (being the offspring of Noah) who were saved from the flood.

data.price: and We created for them similar things on which they ride.
data.arabic: وَخَلَقۡنَا لَهُم مِّن مِّثۡلِهِۦ مَا يَرۡكَبُونَ

data.price: If We willed, We could drown them, then there would be no one to respond to their cry, nor could they be rescued,
data.arabic: وَإِن نَّشَأۡ نُغۡرِقۡهُمۡ فَلَا صَرِيخَ لَهُمۡ وَلَا هُمۡ يُنقَذُونَ

data.price: except by a mercy from Us, leaving them to enjoy for a while.
data.arabic: إِلَّا رَحۡمَةٗ مِّنَّا وَمَتَٰعًا إِلَىٰ حِينٖ

data.price: When it is said to them, “Beware of what is ahead of you and what is behind you[12], so that you may be shown mercy[13].”
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱتَّقُواْ مَا بَيۡنَ أَيۡدِيكُمۡ وَمَا خَلۡفَكُمۡ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تُرۡحَمُونَ
data.footnotes:
[12] Of what awaits you in this life and in the Hereafter, or of the sins of the past and the future.
 [13] But they ignored the warning.

data.price: No sign ever comes to them from their Lord except that they turn away from it.
data.arabic: وَمَا تَأۡتِيهِم مِّنۡ ءَايَةٖ مِّنۡ ءَايَٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ إِلَّا كَانُواْ عَنۡهَا مُعۡرِضِينَ

data.price: And when it is said to them, “Spend of what Allah has provided you with”, the disbelievers say to the believers, “Should we feed those whom Allah could feed if He willed? You are clearly misguided!”
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمۡ أَنفِقُواْ مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ أَنُطۡعِمُ مَن لَّوۡ يَشَآءُ ٱللَّهُ أَطۡعَمَهُۥٓ إِنۡ أَنتُمۡ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٖ

data.price: They say, “When will this promise come to pass, if you are truthful?”
data.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا ٱلۡوَعۡدُ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ

data.price: They are not awaiting but a single Blast that will seize them while they are still disputing[14].
data.arabic: مَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ تَأۡخُذُهُمۡ وَهُمۡ يَخِصِّمُونَ
data.footnotes: [14] The first blast (lit., a cry or a shriek) of the Trumpet will take them by surprise on the Day of Judgment while they will be disputing in their worldly affairs.

data.price: Then they will not be able to make a will, nor will they be able to return to their households.
data.arabic: فَلَا يَسۡتَطِيعُونَ تَوۡصِيَةٗ وَلَآ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِمۡ يَرۡجِعُونَ

data.price: The Trumpet will be blown[15] [again], and at once they will rush from their graves to their Lord.
data.arabic: وَنُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِ فَإِذَا هُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمۡ يَنسِلُونَ
data.footnotes: [15] i.e., the second blast or blow.

data.price: They will say, “Woe to us! Who has resurrected us from our resting place?” [They will be told,] “This is what the Most Compassionate promised, and the messengers told the truth.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ يَٰوَيۡلَنَا مَنۢ بَعَثَنَا مِن مَّرۡقَدِنَاۜۗ هَٰذَا مَا وَعَدَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ وَصَدَقَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ

data.price: It will only be a single Blast, and at once they will all be brought before Us.
data.arabic: إِن كَانَتۡ إِلَّا صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ فَإِذَا هُمۡ جَمِيعٞ لَّدَيۡنَا مُحۡضَرُونَ

data.price: On that Day no soul will be wronged in the least, nor will you be recompensed except for what you used to do.
data.arabic: فَٱلۡيَوۡمَ لَا تُظۡلَمُ نَفۡسٞ شَيۡـٔٗا وَلَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: Indeed, on that Day the people of Paradise will be busy enjoying themselves,
data.arabic: إِنَّ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلۡجَنَّةِ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ فِي شُغُلٖ فَٰكِهُونَ

data.price: they and their spouses will be reclining on couches in the shade.
data.arabic: هُمۡ وَأَزۡوَٰجُهُمۡ فِي ظِلَٰلٍ عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِ مُتَّكِـُٔونَ

data.price: They will have therein fruits and all what they ask for[16].
data.arabic: لَهُمۡ فِيهَا فَٰكِهَةٞ وَلَهُم مَّا يَدَّعُونَ
data.footnotes: [16] i.e., wish or desire.

data.price: “Peace”: a word from a Most Merciful Lord.
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٞ قَوۡلٗا مِّن رَّبّٖ رَّحِيمٖ

data.price: “Stand apart [from the believers] this Day, O wicked ones!
data.arabic: وَٱمۡتَٰزُواْ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ أَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ

data.price: Did I not command you, O children of Adam, not to worship Satan, for he is your sworn enemy,
data.arabic: ۞ أَلَمۡ أَعۡهَدۡ إِلَيۡكُمۡ يَٰبَنِيٓ ءَادَمَ أَن لَّا تَعۡبُدُواْ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنَۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكُمۡ عَدُوّٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: but to worship Me? This is a straight path.
data.arabic: وَأَنِ ٱعۡبُدُونِيۚ هَٰذَا صِرَٰطٞ مُّسۡتَقِيمٞ

data.price: He had already misled great multitudes of you. Did you not then have sense?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَضَلَّ مِنكُمۡ جِبِلّٗا كَثِيرًاۖ أَفَلَمۡ تَكُونُواْ تَعۡقِلُونَ

data.price: This is the Hell that you were promised.
data.arabic: هَٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِي كُنتُمۡ تُوعَدُونَ

data.price: Burn in it Today for your disbelief[17].”
data.arabic: ٱصۡلَوۡهَا ٱلۡيَوۡمَ بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَكۡفُرُونَ
data.footnotes: [17] i.e., because you used to disbelieve.

data.price: Today We will seal up their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify to all what they used to do.
data.arabic: ٱلۡيَوۡمَ نَخۡتِمُ عَلَىٰٓ أَفۡوَٰهِهِمۡ وَتُكَلِّمُنَآ أَيۡدِيهِمۡ وَتَشۡهَدُ أَرۡجُلُهُم بِمَا كَانُواْ يَكۡسِبُونَ

data.price: If We willed, We could have taken away their sight, so they would rush to find their way, but then how could they see?
data.arabic: وَلَوۡ نَشَآءُ لَطَمَسۡنَا عَلَىٰٓ أَعۡيُنِهِمۡ فَٱسۡتَبَقُواْ ٱلصِّرَٰطَ فَأَنَّىٰ يُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: And if We willed, We could have paralyzed them in their places[18], so they could neither move forward nor backward.
data.arabic: وَلَوۡ نَشَآءُ لَمَسَخۡنَٰهُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِهِمۡ فَمَا ٱسۡتَطَٰعُواْ مُضِيّٗا وَلَا يَرۡجِعُونَ
data.footnotes: [18] i.e., We could turn them into inanimate objects.

data.price: Whomsoever We give a long life, We cause his strength to decline[19]. Do they not then understand?
data.arabic: وَمَن نُّعَمِّرۡهُ نُنَكِّسۡهُ فِي ٱلۡخَلۡقِۚ أَفَلَا يَعۡقِلُونَ
data.footnotes: [19] Humans are born weak, then they reach their prime when they are young, then they grow physically and mentally weak when they are old.

data.price: We have not taught him poetry, nor is it fitting for him. This is only a Reminder and a clear Qur’an
data.arabic: وَمَا عَلَّمۡنَٰهُ ٱلشِّعۡرَ وَمَا يَنۢبَغِي لَهُۥٓۚ إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرٞ وَقُرۡءَانٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: so that he may warn those who are truly alive[20] and establish the argument against the disbelievers.
data.arabic: لِّيُنذِرَ مَن كَانَ حَيّٗا وَيَحِقَّ ٱلۡقَوۡلُ عَلَى ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [20] In heart and mind, i.e., those who have faith.

data.price: Do they not see that We have created for them livestock made by Our Hands, and then they are their owners?
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ أَنَّا خَلَقۡنَا لَهُم مِّمَّا عَمِلَتۡ أَيۡدِينَآ أَنۡعَٰمٗا فَهُمۡ لَهَا مَٰلِكُونَ

data.price: And We have made them subservient to them; some they ride, and from others they eat,
data.arabic: وَذَلَّلۡنَٰهَا لَهُمۡ فَمِنۡهَا رَكُوبُهُمۡ وَمِنۡهَا يَأۡكُلُونَ

data.price: and there are other benefits and drinks therein for them. Will they not then give thanks?
data.arabic: وَلَهُمۡ فِيهَا مَنَٰفِعُ وَمَشَارِبُۚ أَفَلَا يَشۡكُرُونَ

data.price: Yet they have taken other gods besides Allah, hoping that they may be helped.
data.arabic: وَٱتَّخَذُواْ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ءَالِهَةٗ لَّعَلَّهُمۡ يُنصَرُونَ

data.price: They cannot help them, yet they serve them as their dedicated guards[21].
data.arabic: لَا يَسۡتَطِيعُونَ نَصۡرَهُمۡ وَهُمۡ لَهُمۡ جُندٞ مُّحۡضَرُونَ
data.footnotes: [21] Or their idols or so-called gods will be assembled to witness the punishment of their worshipers on the Day of Judgment.

data.price: Do not let their words grieve you. Surely We know what they conceal and what they reveal.
data.arabic: فَلَا يَحۡزُنكَ قَوۡلُهُمۡۘ إِنَّا نَعۡلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعۡلِنُونَ

data.price: Does man not see that We have created him from a sperm-drop, then[22] he becomes a clear adversary,
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ أَنَّا خَلَقۡنَٰهُ مِن نُّطۡفَةٖ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٞ مُّبِينٞ
data.footnotes: [22] i.e., as soon as he becomes a self-sufficient being.

data.price: producing arguments[23] against Us while forgetting his own creation[24]. He says, “Who can give life to the bones after they have crumbled to dust?”
data.arabic: وَضَرَبَ لَنَا مَثَلٗا وَنَسِيَ خَلۡقَهُۥۖ قَالَ مَن يُحۡيِ ٱلۡعِظَٰمَ وَهِيَ رَمِيمٞ
data.footnotes:
[23] Trying to prove that there is no life after death.
 [24] That we created him from dead matter to such an extent that he became now a clear disputant before Us.

data.price: Say, “The One Who created them in the first place will give life to them, for He has full knowledge of every created being;
data.arabic: قُلۡ يُحۡيِيهَا ٱلَّذِيٓ أَنشَأَهَآ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٖۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ خَلۡقٍ عَلِيمٌ

data.price: the One Who made for you fire out of the green tree, with which you kindle your fires[25].”
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلشَّجَرِ ٱلۡأَخۡضَرِ نَارٗا فَإِذَآ أَنتُم مِّنۡهُ تُوقِدُونَ
data.footnotes: [25] It alludes to the "markh" and "‘afār" trees in Arabia, whose green branches if struck against each other, it produces sparks.

data.price: Is not the One Who created the heavens and earth able to create the like of these [people]? Yes indeed, for He is the Creator of all, the All-Knowing.
data.arabic: أَوَلَيۡسَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يَخۡلُقَ مِثۡلَهُمۚ بَلَىٰ وَهُوَ ٱلۡخَلَّٰقُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ

data.price: Whenever He wills something to be, He only says to it, “Be”, and it is.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَآ أَمۡرُهُۥٓ إِذَآ أَرَادَ شَيۡـًٔا أَن يَقُولَ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ

data.price: So glory be to the One in Whose Hand is the dominion of everything, and to Him you will all be returned.
data.arabic: فَسُبۡحَٰنَ ٱلَّذِي بِيَدِهِۦ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ وَإِلَيۡهِ تُرۡجَعُونَ

data.price: By those [angels] lined up in rows,
data.arabic: وَٱلصَّٰٓفَّٰتِ صَفّٗا

data.price: and those who drive [the clouds],
data.arabic: فَٱلزَّٰجِرَٰتِ زَجۡرٗا

data.price: and those who recite Allah’s words[1],
data.arabic: فَٱلتَّٰلِيَٰتِ ذِكۡرًا
data.footnotes: [1] Allah swears by three kinds of angels in these three above-mentioned verses to emphasize what comes in the next verse.

data.price: indeed, your God is One,
data.arabic: إِنَّ إِلَٰهَكُمۡ لَوَٰحِدٞ

data.price: Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, and Lord of the points of sunrise.
data.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ ٱلۡمَشَٰرِقِ

data.price: We have adorned the sky with the beauty of the stars,
data.arabic: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا بِزِينَةٍ ٱلۡكَوَاكِبِ

data.price: and for safeguarding it against every rebellious devil,
data.arabic: وَحِفۡظٗا مِّن كُلِّ شَيۡطَٰنٖ مَّارِدٖ

data.price: so that they cannot eavesdrop on the highest assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side[2]
data.arabic: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡمَلَإِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ وَيُقۡذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٖ
data.footnotes: [2] By meteors.

data.price: to repel them; and for them there will be a perpetual punishment,
data.arabic: دُحُورٗاۖ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٞ وَاصِبٌ

data.price: except who stealthily snatches away some words, he will be pursued by a piercing flame.
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَنۡ خَطِفَ ٱلۡخَطۡفَةَ فَأَتۡبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٞ ثَاقِبٞ

data.price: So ask them, “Are they more difficult to create or other things We created? We created them[3] from sticky clay.
data.arabic: فَٱسۡتَفۡتِهِمۡ أَهُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَم مَّنۡ خَلَقۡنَآۚ إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَٰهُم مِّن طِينٖ لَّازِبِۭ
data.footnotes: [3] i.e., their father Adam.

data.price: Rather you are astonished, while they ridicule it,
data.arabic: بَلۡ عَجِبۡتَ وَيَسۡخَرُونَ

data.price: and when they are reminded, they pay no heed,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ذُكِّرُواْ لَا يَذۡكُرُونَ

data.price: and when they see a sign, they ridicule it,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوۡاْ ءَايَةٗ يَسۡتَسۡخِرُونَ

data.price: and they say, “This is nothing but clear magic.
data.arabic: وَقَالُوٓاْ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ مُّبِينٌ

data.price: Is it that when we are dead and become dust and bones, will we really be raised up again,
data.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ

data.price: and our forefathers too?”
data.arabic: أَوَءَابَآؤُنَا ٱلۡأَوَّلُونَ

data.price: Say, “Yes, and you will be disgraced.”
data.arabic: قُلۡ نَعَمۡ وَأَنتُمۡ دَٰخِرُونَ

data.price: It will only be a single Blast[4], and at once they will be looking around.
data.arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجۡرَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ فَإِذَا هُمۡ يَنظُرُونَ
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., the second blow of the Trumpet.

data.price: They will say, “Woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!”
data.arabic: وَقَالُواْ يَٰوَيۡلَنَا هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: [They will be told], “This is the Day of Decision that you used to deny.”
data.arabic: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: [The angels will be told], “Gather all those who did wrong and their fellows[5], and whatever they used to worship
data.arabic: ۞ ٱحۡشُرُواْ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ وَأَزۡوَٰجَهُمۡ وَمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡبُدُونَ
data.footnotes: [5] In wrongdoing or evil deeds.

data.price: besides Allah, and lead them to the way of Hell,
data.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهۡدُوهُمۡ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: and stop them, for they are to be questioned.”
data.arabic: وَقِفُوهُمۡۖ إِنَّهُم مَّسۡـُٔولُونَ

data.price: [They will be asked], “What is the matter with you, that you no longer help one another?”
data.arabic: مَا لَكُمۡ لَا تَنَاصَرُونَ

data.price: Rather on that Day they will surrender completely.
data.arabic: بَلۡ هُمُ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ مُسۡتَسۡلِمُونَ

data.price: They will turn to one another, reproaching one another.
data.arabic: وَأَقۡبَلَ بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ

data.price: [The followers] will say, “It was you who used to delude us from the right way[6].”
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّكُمۡ كُنتُمۡ تَأۡتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ
data.footnotes: [6] Or you used to pressure us, or deceived us with false oaths, or claimed to have the truth.

data.price: [The misleaders] will say, “Rather, you yourselves were not believers,
data.arabic: قَالُواْ بَل لَّمۡ تَكُونُواْ مُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: and We had no power over you, rather you yourselves were a transgressing people.
data.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيۡكُم مِّن سُلۡطَٰنِۭۖ بَلۡ كُنتُمۡ قَوۡمٗا طَٰغِينَ

data.price: Now the punishment of our Lord has come true against us; we will surely taste it.
data.arabic: فَحَقَّ عَلَيۡنَا قَوۡلُ رَبِّنَآۖ إِنَّا لَذَآئِقُونَ

data.price: We did misguide you, for we ourselves were misguided”.
data.arabic: فَأَغۡوَيۡنَٰكُمۡ إِنَّا كُنَّا غَٰوِينَ

data.price: On that Day they will all share in the punishment.
data.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ فِي ٱلۡعَذَابِ مُشۡتَرِكُونَ

data.price: This is how We deal with the wicked,
data.arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَفۡعَلُ بِٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ

data.price: for whenever it was said to them, “None has the right to be worshiped except Allah,” they became arrogant,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُوٓاْ إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمۡ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ يَسۡتَكۡبِرُونَ

data.price: and said, “Are we going to abandon our gods for a mad poet[7]?”
data.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓاْ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٖ مَّجۡنُونِۭ
data.footnotes: [7] They mean the Prophet (ﷺ).

data.price: Rather, he came with the truth and confirmed the messengers.
data.arabic: بَلۡ جَآءَ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَصَدَّقَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: You will surely taste the painful punishment,
data.arabic: إِنَّكُمۡ لَذَآئِقُواْ ٱلۡعَذَابِ ٱلۡأَلِيمِ

data.price: and you will only be recompensed for what you used to do,
data.arabic: وَمَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: except the chosen slaves of Allah.
data.arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ

data.price: They will have a known provision,
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ لَهُمۡ رِزۡقٞ مَّعۡلُومٞ

data.price: fruits[8]; and they will be honored
data.arabic: فَوَٰكِهُ وَهُم مُّكۡرَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [8] i.e., everything delicious that they desire.

data.price: in Gardens of Bliss,
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ

data.price: facing one another[9] on couches.
data.arabic: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مُّتَقَٰبِلِينَ
data.footnotes: [9] It implies that they will not harbor ill feelings toward one another.

data.price: They will be served with a cup of wine from a flowing stream,
data.arabic: يُطَافُ عَلَيۡهِم بِكَأۡسٖ مِّن مَّعِينِۭ

data.price: white and delicious for those who drink.
data.arabic: بَيۡضَآءَ لَذَّةٖ لِّلشَّٰرِبِينَ

data.price: It will cause no harm, nor will they be intoxicated by it,
data.arabic: لَا فِيهَا غَوۡلٞ وَلَا هُمۡ عَنۡهَا يُنزَفُونَ

data.price: and with them will be maidens of modest gaze[10] and beautiful eyes,
data.arabic: وَعِندَهُمۡ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرۡفِ عِينٞ
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., chaste and bashful, looking only at their mates.

data.price: as if they were well-protected eggs[11].
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُنَّ بَيۡضٞ مَّكۡنُونٞ
data.footnotes: [11] Or pristine pearls.

data.price: Then they will turn to one another asking[12].
data.arabic: فَأَقۡبَلَ بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
data.footnotes: [12] Of their lives in the world and what led them to Paradise.

data.price: One of them will say, “I had a close friend [in the world]
data.arabic: قَالَ قَآئِلٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ إِنِّي كَانَ لِي قَرِينٞ

data.price: who used to say[13], ‘Are you one of those who believe
data.arabic: يَقُولُ أَءِنَّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡمُصَدِّقِينَ
data.footnotes: [13] Mockingly.

data.price: that when we die and become dust and bones, shall we be brought for judgment?’”
data.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ

data.price: He will say[14], “Do you wish to see [his fate]?”
data.arabic: قَالَ هَلۡ أَنتُم مُّطَّلِعُونَ
data.footnotes: [14] To his companions in Paradise.

data.price: So he will look down and see him[15] in the midst of the Blazing Fire.
data.arabic: فَٱطَّلَعَ فَرَءَاهُ فِي سَوَآءِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
data.footnotes: [15] His close friend who tried to dissuade him from faith.

data.price: He will say, “By Allah, you were about to ruin me.
data.arabic: قَالَ تَٱللَّهِ إِن كِدتَّ لَتُرۡدِينِ

data.price: Were it not for the grace of my Lord, I would have been among those who are brought [to Hell].”
data.arabic: وَلَوۡلَا نِعۡمَةُ رَبِّي لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُحۡضَرِينَ

data.price: [He will say to his fellow believers], “Are we not going to die anymore,
data.arabic: أَفَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَيِّتِينَ

data.price: except for our first death, nor are we going to be punished?”
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَوۡتَتَنَا ٱلۡأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ

data.price: This is indeed the supreme triumph!
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡعَظِيمُ

data.price: For such [reward] let the workers work.
data.arabic: لِمِثۡلِ هَٰذَا فَلۡيَعۡمَلِ ٱلۡعَٰمِلُونَ

data.price: Is this a better accommodation or the tree of Zaqqūm[16]?[17]
data.arabic: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيۡرٞ نُّزُلًا أَمۡ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ
data.footnotes:
[16] The tree of cactus.
 [17] The disbelievers of Makkah derided the Prophet (ﷺ) when he warned them of this tree. They wondered how a tree could grow in Hellfire. So Allah revealed this verse.

data.price: We have made it a trial for the wrongdoers.
data.arabic: إِنَّا جَعَلۡنَٰهَا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلظَّٰلِمِينَ

data.price: It is a tree that grows in the bottom of the Blazing Fire;
data.arabic: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٞ تَخۡرُجُ فِيٓ أَصۡلِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: its fruits are like heads of devils.
data.arabic: طَلۡعُهَا كَأَنَّهُۥ رُءُوسُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينِ

data.price: They will certainly eat from it, filling their bellies.
data.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمۡ لَأٓكِلُونَ مِنۡهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنۡهَا ٱلۡبُطُونَ

data.price: Then on top of that they will be given a mixture of scalding water,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمۡ عَلَيۡهَا لَشَوۡبٗا مِّنۡ حَمِيمٖ

data.price: then their final return will be to the Blazing Fire.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ مَرۡجِعَهُمۡ لَإِلَى ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: For they found their forefathers astray,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ أَلۡفَوۡاْ ءَابَآءَهُمۡ ضَآلِّينَ

data.price: so they rushed to follow in their footsteps.
data.arabic: فَهُمۡ عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَٰرِهِمۡ يُهۡرَعُونَ

data.price: Indeed, most of the earlier people went astray before them,
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ ضَلَّ قَبۡلَهُمۡ أَكۡثَرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: even though We sent among them warners.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا فِيهِم مُّنذِرِينَ

data.price: Then see how was the end of those who were warned,
data.arabic: فَٱنظُرۡ كَيۡفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ

data.price: except the chosen slaves of Allah.
data.arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ

data.price: Indeed, Noah called upon Us; how excellent are We at responding!
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ نَادَىٰنَا نُوحٞ فَلَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡمُجِيبُونَ

data.price: And We saved him and his household[18] from the great distress,
data.arabic: وَنَجَّيۡنَٰهُ وَأَهۡلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلۡكَرۡبِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
data.footnotes: [18] i.e., the believers in his household.

data.price: and made his offspring[19] the only survivors,
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُۥ هُمُ ٱلۡبَاقِينَ
data.footnotes: [19] i.e., Noah’s offspring: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

data.price: and We left for him [a favorable mention] among later generations:
data.arabic: وَتَرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: “Peace be upon Noah among all the nations.”
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰ نُوحٖ فِي ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: This is how We reward those who do good.
data.arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: He was one of Our believing slaves.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ مِنۡ عِبَادِنَا ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Then we drowned the others.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَغۡرَقۡنَا ٱلۡأٓخَرِينَ

data.price: Indeed, Abraham was one of those who followed his way.
data.arabic: ۞ وَإِنَّ مِن شِيعَتِهِۦ لَإِبۡرَٰهِيمَ

data.price: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart,
data.arabic: إِذۡ جَآءَ رَبَّهُۥ بِقَلۡبٖ سَلِيمٍ

data.price: and said to his father and his people, “What are you worshiping?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: Is it false gods that you seek other than Allah?
data.arabic: أَئِفۡكًا ءَالِهَةٗ دُونَ ٱللَّهِ تُرِيدُونَ

data.price: Then what do you think of the Lord of the worlds?”
data.arabic: فَمَا ظَنُّكُم بِرَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: He then cast a glance at the stars[20],
data.arabic: فَنَظَرَ نَظۡرَةٗ فِي ٱلنُّجُومِ
data.footnotes: [20] His people had faith in astrology, so Abraham pretended to do the same to show them that he was not able to join them at their pagan feast and to remain in their temple of idols, while he was planning to destroy their idols.

data.price: and said, “I am sick[21].”
data.arabic: فَقَالَ إِنِّي سَقِيمٞ
data.footnotes: [21] The Prophet (ﷺ) said: “Ibrahim (peace be upon him) did not lie except for three lies: His saying {I am sick} and his saying {Rather, the chief of them did this} and his saying about his wife, “She is my sister.” [Al-Bukhāri, Muslim]. Two of them were for the sake of Allah, and the third one was for the sake of his sister.

data.price: So they went away from him and left.
data.arabic: فَتَوَلَّوۡاْ عَنۡهُ مُدۡبِرِينَ

data.price: Then he turned to their gods and said, “Why do you not eat[22]?
data.arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِهِمۡ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ
data.footnotes: [22] The offerings placed before you.

data.price: What is wrong with you that you do not speak?”
data.arabic: مَا لَكُمۡ لَا تَنطِقُونَ

data.price: Then he turned upon them, striking them with his right hand.
data.arabic: فَرَاغَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ ضَرۡبَۢا بِٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: Then his people came rushing towards him.
data.arabic: فَأَقۡبَلُوٓاْ إِلَيۡهِ يَزِفُّونَ

data.price: He said, “Do you worship what you yourselves carve,
data.arabic: قَالَ أَتَعۡبُدُونَ مَا تَنۡحِتُونَ

data.price: when it is Allah Who created you and all what you do?”
data.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ خَلَقَكُمۡ وَمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: They said, “Build a pyre for him and throw him into the blazing fire.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ ٱبۡنُواْ لَهُۥ بُنۡيَٰنٗا فَأَلۡقُوهُ فِي ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: They contrived a plan against him, but We made them the lowest.
data.arabic: فَأَرَادُواْ بِهِۦ كَيۡدٗا فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُمُ ٱلۡأَسۡفَلِينَ

data.price: He said, “I am going to my Lord; He will guide me.
data.arabic: وَقَالَ إِنِّي ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّي سَيَهۡدِينِ

data.price: My Lord, grant me righteous offspring.”
data.arabic: رَبِّ هَبۡ لِي مِنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ

data.price: So We gave him glad tidings of a forbearing boy[23].
data.arabic: فَبَشَّرۡنَٰهُ بِغُلَٰمٍ حَلِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [23] i.e., Ishmael

data.price: Then when he reached the age where he could work with him, Abraham said, “O my dear son, I have seen in a dream that I must sacrifice you. What do you think?” He said, “O my dear father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allah wills, one of the steadfast.”
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعۡيَ قَالَ يَٰبُنَيَّ إِنِّيٓ أَرَىٰ فِي ٱلۡمَنَامِ أَنِّيٓ أَذۡبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرۡ مَاذَا تَرَىٰۚ قَالَ يَٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفۡعَلۡ مَا تُؤۡمَرُۖ سَتَجِدُنِيٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰبِرِينَ

data.price: When they both submitted [to Allah’s command] and Abraham laid him on his forehead,
data.arabic: فَلَمَّآ أَسۡلَمَا وَتَلَّهُۥ لِلۡجَبِينِ

data.price: and We called out to him, “O Abraham,
data.arabic: وَنَٰدَيۡنَٰهُ أَن يَٰٓإِبۡرَٰهِيمُ

data.price: You have fulfilled the dream.” This is how We reward those who do good.
data.arabic: قَدۡ صَدَّقۡتَ ٱلرُّءۡيَآۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: This was indeed a revealing test.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلۡبَلَٰٓؤُاْ ٱلۡمُبِينُ

data.price: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice[24],
data.arabic: وَفَدَيۡنَٰهُ بِذِبۡحٍ عَظِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [24] Allah Almighty sent a ram to be sacrificed in place of Ishmael.

data.price: and We left for him [a favorable mention] among later generations:
data.arabic: وَتَرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: “Peace be upon Abraham.”
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰٓ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ

data.price: This is how We reward those who do good.
data.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: He was one of Our believing slaves.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ مِنۡ عِبَادِنَا ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: And We gave him the glad tidings of Isaac[25], a prophet, and one of the righteous.
data.arabic: وَبَشَّرۡنَٰهُ بِإِسۡحَٰقَ نَبِيّٗا مِّنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
data.footnotes: [25] The birth of Isaac is mentioned after the story of sacrifice, which verifies that the firstborn son who was sacrificed was indeed Ishmael and not Isaac, contrary to what is claimed by the Jews and Christians. This is also supported by 11:71, where Sarah is told that she would give birth to Isaac, who would have a son by the name of Jacob.

data.price: We blessed him[26] and Isaac, but among their offspring were some who did good and some who clearly wronged themselves.
data.arabic: وَبَٰرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ وَعَلَىٰٓ إِسۡحَٰقَۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحۡسِنٞ وَظَالِمٞ لِّنَفۡسِهِۦ مُبِينٞ
data.footnotes: [26] Abraham or Ishmael.

data.price: Indeed, We bestowed Our favor upon Moses and Aaron,
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ مَنَنَّا عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ

data.price: and We saved them and their people from the great distress[27],
data.arabic: وَنَجَّيۡنَٰهُمَا وَقَوۡمَهُمَا مِنَ ٱلۡكَرۡبِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
data.footnotes: [27] Of enslavement at the hands of Pharaoh and his people, as well as of drowning.

data.price: and We helped them, so they were victorious,
data.arabic: وَنَصَرۡنَٰهُمۡ فَكَانُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ

data.price: and We gave them both the clear Scripture,
data.arabic: وَءَاتَيۡنَٰهُمَا ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ ٱلۡمُسۡتَبِينَ

data.price: and guided them to the straight path;
data.arabic: وَهَدَيۡنَٰهُمَا ٱلصِّرَٰطَ ٱلۡمُسۡتَقِيمَ

data.price: and We left for them [a favorable mention] among later generations:
data.arabic: وَتَرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمَا فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: “Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.”
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ

data.price: This is how We reward those who do good.
data.arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: They were truly of Our believing slaves.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمَا مِنۡ عِبَادِنَا ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Elijah was indeed one of the messengers.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ إِلۡيَاسَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: When he said to his people: “Do you not fear Allah?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لِقَوۡمِهِۦٓ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: Do you call upon Ba‘l[28] and ignore the Best of the Creators,
data.arabic: أَتَدۡعُونَ بَعۡلٗا وَتَذَرُونَ أَحۡسَنَ ٱلۡخَٰلِقِينَ
data.footnotes: [28] A great idol worshiped by the people.

data.price: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?”
data.arabic: ٱللَّهَ رَبَّكُمۡ وَرَبَّ ءَابَآئِكُمُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: But they rejected him, so they will surely be brought [for punishment],
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَإِنَّهُمۡ لَمُحۡضَرُونَ

data.price: except the chosen slaves of Allah.
data.arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ

data.price: And We left for him [a favorable mention] among later generations:
data.arabic: وَتَرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: “Peace be upon Elias.”
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰٓ إِلۡ يَاسِينَ

data.price: This is how We reward those who do good.
data.arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: He was one of Our believing slaves.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ مِنۡ عِبَادِنَا ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: Lot was indeed one of the messengers.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ لُوطٗا لَّمِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: When We saved him and all of his household,
data.arabic: إِذۡ نَجَّيۡنَٰهُ وَأَهۡلَهُۥٓ أَجۡمَعِينَ

data.price: except an old woman[29] who was among those who stayed behind.
data.arabic: إِلَّا عَجُوزٗا فِي ٱلۡغَٰبِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [29] Lot’s wife, who was not a believer.

data.price: Then We destroyed the rest.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ دَمَّرۡنَا ٱلۡأٓخَرِينَ

data.price: You [Makkans] pass by their ruins by day
data.arabic: وَإِنَّكُمۡ لَتَمُرُّونَ عَلَيۡهِم مُّصۡبِحِينَ

data.price: and by night. Do you still not understand?
data.arabic: وَبِٱلَّيۡلِۚ أَفَلَا تَعۡقِلُونَ

data.price: Jonah was indeed one of the messengers.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ يُونُسَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: When he fled to the fully laden ship,
data.arabic: إِذۡ أَبَقَ إِلَى ٱلۡفُلۡكِ ٱلۡمَشۡحُونِ

data.price: then he cast lots[30] with them, but was among those who lost.
data.arabic: فَسَاهَمَ فَكَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُدۡحَضِينَ
data.footnotes: [30] To determine who would be cast overboard in order to save the rest of the passengers; the ship was about to sink, for it was overloaded.

data.price: The whale then swallowed him while he was blameworthy[31].
data.arabic: فَٱلۡتَقَمَهُ ٱلۡحُوتُ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٞ
data.footnotes: [31] For leaving his people without Allah’s permission.

data.price: Were it not for the fact that he was one of those who glorify Allah,
data.arabic: فَلَوۡلَآ أَنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُسَبِّحِينَ

data.price: he would have stayed in its belly until the Day of Resurrection[32].
data.arabic: لَلَبِثَ فِي بَطۡنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ يُبۡعَثُونَ
data.footnotes: [32] The belly of the fish would have turned to be his grave.

data.price: But We cast him ashore on a barren land while he was ill,
data.arabic: ۞ فَنَبَذۡنَٰهُ بِٱلۡعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ سَقِيمٞ

data.price: and caused a gourd vine[33] to grow over him.
data.arabic: وَأَنۢبَتۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ شَجَرَةٗ مِّن يَقۡطِينٖ
data.footnotes: [33] For its cooling shade and as food for him.

data.price: We sent him[34] to one hundred thousand people or more,
data.arabic: وَأَرۡسَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ مِاْئَةِ أَلۡفٍ أَوۡ يَزِيدُونَ
data.footnotes: [34] i.e., We sent him thereafter to his people.

data.price: and they believed, so We let them enjoy for a while.
data.arabic: فَـَٔامَنُواْ فَمَتَّعۡنَٰهُمۡ إِلَىٰ حِينٖ

data.price: So ask them, “Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?”[35]
data.arabic: فَٱسۡتَفۡتِهِمۡ أَلِرَبِّكَ ٱلۡبَنَاتُ وَلَهُمُ ٱلۡبَنُونَ
data.footnotes: [35] The pagans of Makkah claimed that angels were Allah’s daughters, while preferring sons for themselves.

data.price: Or did We create the angels as females while they were watching?
data.arabic: أَمۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ إِنَٰثٗا وَهُمۡ شَٰهِدُونَ

data.price: No indeed, it is one of their fabrications when they say,
data.arabic: أَلَآ إِنَّهُم مِّنۡ إِفۡكِهِمۡ لَيَقُولُونَ

data.price: “Allah has children,” and they are truly liars.
data.arabic: وَلَدَ ٱللَّهُ وَإِنَّهُمۡ لَكَٰذِبُونَ

data.price: Did He choose daughters over sons[36]?
data.arabic: أَصۡطَفَى ٱلۡبَنَاتِ عَلَى ٱلۡبَنِينَ
data.footnotes: [36] i.e., daughters that you hate over sons that you like?

data.price: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?
data.arabic: مَا لَكُمۡ كَيۡفَ تَحۡكُمُونَ

data.price: Will you not then take heed?
data.arabic: أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ

data.price: Do you have any compelling proof?
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَكُمۡ سُلۡطَٰنٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: Then bring your scripture, if you are truthful.
data.arabic: فَأۡتُواْ بِكِتَٰبِكُمۡ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ

data.price: They claim that there is a kinship between Him and the jinn[37], when the jinn themselves know that such people will surely be brought [for punishment].
data.arabic: وَجَعَلُواْ بَيۡنَهُۥ وَبَيۡنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ نَسَبٗاۚ وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمَتِ ٱلۡجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمۡ لَمُحۡضَرُونَ
data.footnotes: [37] It was claimed by some Arab pagans that angels are daughters of Allah through female jinn.

data.price: Glorified is Allah far above what they ascribe [to Him].
data.arabic: سُبۡحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ

data.price: But not the chosen slaves of Allah[38].
data.arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ
data.footnotes: [38] Who do not ascribe to Allah such false claims.

data.price: So you and whatever you worship
data.arabic: فَإِنَّكُمۡ وَمَا تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: none of you can lure anyone away from Him,
data.arabic: مَآ أَنتُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ بِفَٰتِنِينَ

data.price: except those who are destined to burn in the Blazing Fire[39].
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَنۡ هُوَ صَالِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
data.footnotes: [39] Due to their disbelief and evil deeds.

data.price: [The angels say][40], “There is none among us but has a known station[41]:
data.arabic: وَمَا مِنَّآ إِلَّا لَهُۥ مَقَامٞ مَّعۡلُومٞ
data.footnotes:
[40] Refuting the disbelievers’ false claims about them.
 [41] In worshiping Allah and obeying Him in our assigned tasks.

data.price: We are indeed those who stand lined up in rows,
data.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ ٱلصَّآفُّونَ

data.price: and we are indeed those who glorify Allah.”
data.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ ٱلۡمُسَبِّحُونَ

data.price: And [the pagans] used to say[42],
data.arabic: وَإِن كَانُواْ لَيَقُولُونَ
data.footnotes: [42] Before the revelation of the Qur’an.

data.price: “If only we had a scripture[43] like the previous people,
data.arabic: لَوۡ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكۡرٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
data.footnotes: [43] Such as the Torah and the Gospel.

data.price: we would have surely been true slaves of Allah.”
data.arabic: لَكُنَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ

data.price: But they rejected it[44]; soon they will come to know.
data.arabic: فَكَفَرُواْ بِهِۦۖ فَسَوۡفَ يَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [44] i.e., their own message, the Qur’an.

data.price: Our Word has already been given to Our slaves, the messengers,
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ سَبَقَتۡ كَلِمَتُنَا لِعِبَادِنَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: that it is surely they who will be given victory,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ لَهُمُ ٱلۡمَنصُورُونَ

data.price: and that Our soldiers will surely be the victors.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ جُندَنَا لَهُمُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبُونَ

data.price: So turn away from them for a while.
data.arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ حَتَّىٰ حِينٖ

data.price: Wait and see; soon they will see [their end].
data.arabic: وَأَبۡصِرۡهُمۡ فَسَوۡفَ يُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: Do they really seek to hasten Our punishment?
data.arabic: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسۡتَعۡجِلُونَ

data.price: When it[45] descends on their courtyard, how terrible will be the morning of those who were warned!
data.arabic: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمۡ فَسَآءَ صَبَاحُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ
data.footnotes: [45] Allah’s punishment.

data.price: And turn away from them for a while.
data.arabic: وَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ حَتَّىٰ حِينٖ

data.price: Wait and see; soon they will see [their end].
data.arabic: وَأَبۡصِرۡ فَسَوۡفَ يُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: Glory be to your Lord, the Lord of Might, far above what they ascribe [to Him],
data.arabic: سُبۡحَٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ ٱلۡعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ

data.price: and peace be upon the messengers,
data.arabic: وَسَلَٰمٌ عَلَى ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: and all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡحَمۡدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: Sād[1]. By the Qur’an, full of reminder[2],
data.arabic: صٓۚ وَٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ ذِي ٱلذِّكۡرِ
data.footnotes:
[1] See footnote 2:1.
 [2] The oath's completion is that the Qur’an is inimitable and thus Allah's miracle.

data.price: yet those who disbelieve are in arrogance and dissension.
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ فِي عِزَّةٖ وَشِقَاقٖ

data.price: How many generations have We destroyed before them, and they cried out when it was too late for deliverance.
data.arabic: كَمۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِن قَبۡلِهِم مِّن قَرۡنٖ فَنَادَواْ وَّلَاتَ حِينَ مَنَاصٖ

data.price: They wonder that a warner has come to them from among themselves[3], and the disbelievers say, “This is a magician and a liar!
data.arabic: وَعَجِبُوٓاْ أَن جَآءَهُم مُّنذِرٞ مِّنۡهُمۡۖ وَقَالَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا سَٰحِرٞ كَذَّابٌ
data.footnotes: [3] The disbelievers demanded that an angel be sent to them to convey the message of Allah, not a human like themselves.

data.price: Has he made all gods into one God? Indeed, this is something strange!”
data.arabic: أَجَعَلَ ٱلۡأٓلِهَةَ إِلَٰهٗا وَٰحِدًاۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيۡءٌ عُجَابٞ

data.price: The leaders among them departed, saying, “Carry on as you are, and stay faithful to your gods. Indeed, there is a motive behind it[4].
data.arabic: وَٱنطَلَقَ ٱلۡمَلَأُ مِنۡهُمۡ أَنِ ٱمۡشُواْ وَٱصۡبِرُواْ عَلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِكُمۡۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيۡءٞ يُرَادُ
data.footnotes: [4] i.e., The Prophet (ﷺ) only wants to gain influence and prestige for himself.

data.price: We have not heard of this in the last religion[5]. This is nothing but a fabrication.
data.arabic: مَا سَمِعۡنَا بِهَٰذَا فِي ٱلۡمِلَّةِ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا ٱخۡتِلَٰقٌ
data.footnotes: [5] It refers to Christianity or pagan Arab beliefs.

data.price: Has the Reminder been sent down to him from among us?” Rather, they are in doubt about My Reminder[6], for they have not yet tasted My punishment.
data.arabic: أَءُنزِلَ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلذِّكۡرُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِنَاۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ فِي شَكّٖ مِّن ذِكۡرِيۚ بَل لَّمَّا يَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِ
data.footnotes: [6] They do not question the Prophet's (ﷺ) honesty; rather, they question the Qur’an itself. See 6:33.

data.price: Or do they possess the treasuries of the mercy of your Lord, the All-Mighty, the Bestower?
data.arabic: أَمۡ عِندَهُمۡ خَزَآئِنُ رَحۡمَةِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلۡوَهَّابِ

data.price: Or do they have the dominion of the heavens and earth and all that is between them? Then let them ascend by any means[7].
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَهُم مُّلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَاۖ فَلۡيَرۡتَقُواْ فِي ٱلۡأَسۡبَٰبِ
data.footnotes: [7] To manage the affairs of their dominion.

data.price: This is only a small army[8] among several armies[9] that will soon be defeated.
data.arabic: جُندٞ مَّا هُنَالِكَ مَهۡزُومٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَحۡزَابِ
data.footnotes:
[8] It alludes to the defeat of the pagans of Makkah at Badr.
 [9] i.e., the defeated armies of the past who rejected their messengers.

data.price: The people of Noah rejected [their messengers] before them, as did ‘Aad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes[10];
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحٖ وَعَادٞ وَفِرۡعَوۡنُ ذُو ٱلۡأَوۡتَادِ
data.footnotes: [10] It refers to the stakes by which he used to torture people, or the pyramids which are like stakes into the earth.

data.price: and Thamūd and the people of Lot, and the dwellers of the Forest – such were the [denier] parties.
data.arabic: وَثَمُودُ وَقَوۡمُ لُوطٖ وَأَصۡحَٰبُ لۡـَٔيۡكَةِۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلۡأَحۡزَابُ

data.price: Each of them rejected their messenger, therefore My punishment became inevitable.
data.arabic: إِن كُلٌّ إِلَّا كَذَّبَ ٱلرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقَابِ

data.price: They are only waiting for a single Blast that cannot be stopped[11].
data.arabic: وَمَا يَنظُرُ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ إِلَّا صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ مَّا لَهَا مِن فَوَاقٖ
data.footnotes: [11] Fawāq: "respite", more literally, "a period between two milkings of a she-camel," which also alludes to "return" or "repetition."

data.price: They say, “Our Lord, hasten for us our share [of punishment] before the Day of Reckoning.”
data.arabic: وَقَالُواْ رَبَّنَا عَجِّل لَّنَا قِطَّنَا قَبۡلَ يَوۡمِ ٱلۡحِسَابِ

data.price: Bear with patience whatever they say, and remember Our slave David, the man of strength who constantly turned [to Allah].
data.arabic: ٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱذۡكُرۡ عَبۡدَنَا دَاوُۥدَ ذَا ٱلۡأَيۡدِۖ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌ

data.price: We subjected the mountains to join him in glorifying Allah in the evening and the morning,
data.arabic: إِنَّا سَخَّرۡنَا ٱلۡجِبَالَ مَعَهُۥ يُسَبِّحۡنَ بِٱلۡعَشِيِّ وَٱلۡإِشۡرَاقِ

data.price: and the birds, in their flocks; they all would echo his praise.
data.arabic: وَٱلطَّيۡرَ مَحۡشُورَةٗۖ كُلّٞ لَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٞ

data.price: We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and sound judgment [and speech].
data.arabic: وَشَدَدۡنَا مُلۡكَهُۥ وَءَاتَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلۡحِكۡمَةَ وَفَصۡلَ ٱلۡخِطَابِ

data.price: Has there come to you the story of the adversaries, when they climbed the wall of his chamber?
data.arabic: ۞ وَهَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ نَبَؤُاْ ٱلۡخَصۡمِ إِذۡ تَسَوَّرُواْ ٱلۡمِحۡرَابَ

data.price: When they entered upon David, he was frightened. They said, “Do not be afraid. We are two adversaries: one of us has wronged the other, so judge between us with fairness, and do not be unjust, and guide us to the straight path.
data.arabic: إِذۡ دَخَلُواْ عَلَىٰ دَاوُۥدَ فَفَزِعَ مِنۡهُمۡۖ قَالُواْ لَا تَخَفۡۖ خَصۡمَانِ بَغَىٰ بَعۡضُنَا عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ فَٱحۡكُم بَيۡنَنَا بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَلَا تُشۡطِطۡ وَٱهۡدِنَآ إِلَىٰ سَوَآءِ ٱلصِّرَٰطِ

data.price: This is my brother[12]. He has ninety-nine ewes while I have only one. He said, ‘Give her into my charge,’ and he overpowered me in speech.”
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَآ أَخِي لَهُۥ تِسۡعٞ وَتِسۡعُونَ نَعۡجَةٗ وَلِيَ نَعۡجَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ فَقَالَ أَكۡفِلۡنِيهَا وَعَزَّنِي فِي ٱلۡخِطَابِ
data.footnotes: [12] i.e., brother in faith, business partner, or biological brother.

data.price: David said, “He has certainly wronged you by demanding that your ewe be added to his flock. Indeed, many partners oppress one another, except those who believe and do righteous deeds – and how few they are.” Then David realized that We were only testing him, so he asked his Lord for forgiveness[13], fell down bowing, and turned to Him in repentance.
data.arabic: قَالَ لَقَدۡ ظَلَمَكَ بِسُؤَالِ نَعۡجَتِكَ إِلَىٰ نِعَاجِهِۦۖ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡخُلَطَآءِ لَيَبۡغِي بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٍ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَقَلِيلٞ مَّا هُمۡۗ وَظَنَّ دَاوُۥدُ أَنَّمَا فَتَنَّٰهُ فَٱسۡتَغۡفَرَ رَبَّهُۥ وَخَرَّۤ رَاكِعٗاۤ وَأَنَابَ۩
data.footnotes: [13] For fear of the two men or the misjudgment he made.

data.price: So We forgave that for him, and he certainly has a place of nearness to Us and a good place of return.
data.arabic: فَغَفَرۡنَا لَهُۥ ذَٰلِكَۖ وَإِنَّ لَهُۥ عِندَنَا لَزُلۡفَىٰ وَحُسۡنَ مَـَٔابٖ

data.price: “O David, We have made you a ruler on earth, so judge between people with justice, and do not follow your desires lest they lead you astray from Allah’s way. Those who go astray from Allah’s way will have a severe punishment because of their forgetting the Day of Reckoning.”
data.arabic: يَٰدَاوُۥدُ إِنَّا جَعَلۡنَٰكَ خَلِيفَةٗ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ فَٱحۡكُم بَيۡنَ ٱلنَّاسِ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَلَا تَتَّبِعِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰ فَيُضِلَّكَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِۚ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَضِلُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ لَهُمۡ عَذَابٞ شَدِيدُۢ بِمَا نَسُواْ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡحِسَابِ

data.price: We have not created the heavens and earth and all that is between them in vain. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve. So woe to the disbelievers from the Fire!
data.arabic: وَمَا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا بَٰطِلٗاۚ ذَٰلِكَ ظَنُّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْۚ فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِنَ ٱلنَّارِ

data.price: Should We make those who believe and do righteous deeds equal to those who spread corruption on earth? Or should We make the righteous equal to the wicked?
data.arabic: أَمۡ نَجۡعَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ كَٱلۡمُفۡسِدِينَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ أَمۡ نَجۡعَلُ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ كَٱلۡفُجَّارِ

data.price: This is a blessed Book that We have sent down to you [O Prophet] so that they may reflect upon its verses, and so that people of understanding may take heed.
data.arabic: كِتَٰبٌ أَنزَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَيۡكَ مُبَٰرَكٞ لِّيَدَّبَّرُوٓاْ ءَايَٰتِهِۦ وَلِيَتَذَكَّرَ أُوْلُواْ ٱلۡأَلۡبَٰبِ

data.price: And to David We gave Solomon, an excellent and faithful slave who constantly turned [to Us].
data.arabic: وَوَهَبۡنَا لِدَاوُۥدَ سُلَيۡمَٰنَۚ نِعۡمَ ٱلۡعَبۡدُ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌ

data.price: One evening, well-trained and swift horses of noble breed were presented before him.
data.arabic: إِذۡ عُرِضَ عَلَيۡهِ بِٱلۡعَشِيِّ ٱلصَّٰفِنَٰتُ ٱلۡجِيَادُ

data.price: He then said, “I gave preference to the love of fine things over the remembrance of my Lord,” until the sun went out of sight.
data.arabic: فَقَالَ إِنِّيٓ أَحۡبَبۡتُ حُبَّ ٱلۡخَيۡرِ عَن ذِكۡرِ رَبِّي حَتَّىٰ تَوَارَتۡ بِٱلۡحِجَابِ

data.price: [He ordered], “Bring them back to me,” and he began striking [their] shanks and necks[14].
data.arabic: رُدُّوهَا عَلَيَّۖ فَطَفِقَ مَسۡحَۢا بِٱلسُّوقِ وَٱلۡأَعۡنَاقِ
data.footnotes: [14] With his sword as expiation, for it might have been permissible in their law, especially if it had been for the sake of Allah such as missing prayer or the like; this is a more correct view. However, Ibn Jarīr favored the view that Solomon began to rub down their legs and necks with the hand, not by the sword.

data.price: Indeed, We tested Solomon and cast upon his throne a body, then he turned [to Allah][15].
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ فَتَنَّا سُلَيۡمَٰنَ وَأَلۡقَيۡنَا عَلَىٰ كُرۡسِيِّهِۦ جَسَدٗا ثُمَّ أَنَابَ
data.footnotes: [15] The Prophet (ﷺ) said that one night Solomon said that each one of his wives would conceive a boy who would fight for the sake of Allah. He forgot to say ‘Allah willing,’ so only one of them gave birth to a deformed, dead baby. So Solomon sought Allah’s forgiveness. [Al-Bukhāri]

data.price: He said, “My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom, the like of which will never be granted to anyone after me. You are indeed the Bestower.”
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱغۡفِرۡ لِي وَهَبۡ لِي مُلۡكٗا لَّا يَنۢبَغِي لِأَحَدٖ مِّنۢ بَعۡدِيٓۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلۡوَهَّابُ

data.price: So We subjected to him the wind blowing gently by his command to wherever he wished,
data.arabic: فَسَخَّرۡنَا لَهُ ٱلرِّيحَ تَجۡرِي بِأَمۡرِهِۦ رُخَآءً حَيۡثُ أَصَابَ

data.price: And [We subjected to him] the devils, all kinds of builders and divers[16],
data.arabic: وَٱلشَّيَٰطِينَ كُلَّ بَنَّآءٖ وَغَوَّاصٖ
data.footnotes: [16] They dived to bring him pearls.

data.price: and others bound in chains.
data.arabic: وَءَاخَرِينَ مُقَرَّنِينَ فِي ٱلۡأَصۡفَادِ

data.price: [We said], “This is Our gift, so give freely or withhold, without account[17].”
data.arabic: هَٰذَا عَطَآؤُنَا فَٱمۡنُنۡ أَوۡ أَمۡسِكۡ بِغَيۡرِ حِسَابٖ
data.footnotes: [17] i.e., you will not be called to account thereby.

data.price: And he certainly has a status of nearness to Us and a good place of return.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ لَهُۥ عِندَنَا لَزُلۡفَىٰ وَحُسۡنَ مَـَٔابٖ

data.price: And remember Our slave Job, when he cried out to his Lord, “Indeed, Satan has afflicted me with hardship and pain.”
data.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرۡ عَبۡدَنَآ أَيُّوبَ إِذۡ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّي مَسَّنِيَ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنُ بِنُصۡبٖ وَعَذَابٍ

data.price: [Allah said], “Stamp [the ground] with your foot: here is a cool spring for bathing and drinking.”
data.arabic: ٱرۡكُضۡ بِرِجۡلِكَۖ هَٰذَا مُغۡتَسَلُۢ بَارِدٞ وَشَرَابٞ

data.price: And We restored his family to him and the like of them[18] as a mercy from Us and as a reminder for people of understanding.
data.arabic: وَوَهَبۡنَا لَهُۥٓ أَهۡلَهُۥ وَمِثۡلَهُم مَّعَهُمۡ رَحۡمَةٗ مِّنَّا وَذِكۡرَىٰ لِأُوْلِي ٱلۡأَلۡبَٰبِ
data.footnotes: [18] When Allah granted him health, the whole family returned to him and he was granted even more children.

data.price: [We said], “Take a bunch of grass in your hand, and strike [your wife] with it, and do not break your oath[19].” We truly found him patient – an excellent and faithful slave he was. He constantly turned [to Us].
data.arabic: وَخُذۡ بِيَدِكَ ضِغۡثٗا فَٱضۡرِب بِّهِۦ وَلَا تَحۡنَثۡۗ إِنَّا وَجَدۡنَٰهُ صَابِرٗاۚ نِّعۡمَ ٱلۡعَبۡدُ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٞ
data.footnotes: [19] When Job was afflicted with illness, everyone abandoned him except his wife. Once he became angry with her and vowed to punish her with one hundred lashes if he recovered. According to Allah's instruction, the oath was fulfilled by striking her once with one hundred blades of grass without harming his wife.

data.price: Remember Our slaves: Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob – men of strength and insight.
data.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرۡ عِبَٰدَنَآ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسۡحَٰقَ وَيَعۡقُوبَ أُوْلِي ٱلۡأَيۡدِي وَٱلۡأَبۡصَٰرِ

data.price: We chose them exclusively for the remembrance of the Final Home.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَخۡلَصۡنَٰهُم بِخَالِصَةٖ ذِكۡرَى ٱلدَّارِ

data.price: Indeed, they are before us among the chosen and best ones.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُمۡ عِندَنَا لَمِنَ ٱلۡمُصۡطَفَيۡنَ ٱلۡأَخۡيَارِ

data.price: Also remember Ishmael, Elisha, and Dhul-Kifl[20] – all were among the best.
data.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرۡ إِسۡمَٰعِيلَ وَٱلۡيَسَعَ وَذَا ٱلۡكِفۡلِۖ وَكُلّٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَخۡيَارِ
data.footnotes: [20] Scholars are of different opinions as to whether Dhul-Kifl was a prophet or only a righteous man.

data.price: This is a reminder. And the righteous will surely have a good return:
data.arabic: هَٰذَا ذِكۡرٞۚ وَإِنَّ لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ لَحُسۡنَ مَـَٔابٖ

data.price: Gardens of Eternity, with gates wide open for them.
data.arabic: جَنَّٰتِ عَدۡنٖ مُّفَتَّحَةٗ لَّهُمُ ٱلۡأَبۡوَٰبُ

data.price: They will recline therein, calling for abundant fruit and drink.
data.arabic: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا يَدۡعُونَ فِيهَا بِفَٰكِهَةٖ كَثِيرَةٖ وَشَرَابٖ

data.price: And they will have maidens of modest gaze[21] and equal age.
data.arabic: ۞ وَعِندَهُمۡ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرۡفِ أَتۡرَابٌ
data.footnotes: [21] Their gaze will be restricted to their mates alone.

data.price: This is what you are promised for the Day of Account.
data.arabic: هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِيَوۡمِ ٱلۡحِسَابِ

data.price: Indeed, this is Our provision [for the righteous] that will never cease.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَرِزۡقُنَا مَا لَهُۥ مِن نَّفَادٍ

data.price: This [is so]. But the transgressors will surely have the worst return:
data.arabic: هَٰذَاۚ وَإِنَّ لِلطَّٰغِينَ لَشَرَّ مَـَٔابٖ

data.price: Hell, where they will burn. What a terrible resting place!
data.arabic: جَهَنَّمَ يَصۡلَوۡنَهَا فَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡمِهَادُ

data.price: Let them taste this: scalding water and pus,
data.arabic: هَٰذَا فَلۡيَذُوقُوهُ حَمِيمٞ وَغَسَّاقٞ

data.price: and other similar [torments] of various kinds.
data.arabic: وَءَاخَرُ مِن شَكۡلِهِۦٓ أَزۡوَٰجٌ

data.price: [The misleaders will say], “Here is a crowd of people being thrown in with you. They are not welcome! They will surely burn in the Fire.”
data.arabic: هَٰذَا فَوۡجٞ مُّقۡتَحِمٞ مَّعَكُمۡ لَا مَرۡحَبَۢا بِهِمۡۚ إِنَّهُمۡ صَالُواْ ٱلنَّارِ

data.price: They will say, “No! You are not welcome! You brought this on us. What a terrible place to settle in!”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ بَلۡ أَنتُمۡ لَا مَرۡحَبَۢا بِكُمۡۖ أَنتُمۡ قَدَّمۡتُمُوهُ لَنَاۖ فَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡقَرَارُ

data.price: They will say, “Our Lord, whoever brought this on us, give him double punishment in the Fire.”
data.arabic: قَالُواْ رَبَّنَا مَن قَدَّمَ لَنَا هَٰذَا فَزِدۡهُ عَذَابٗا ضِعۡفٗا فِي ٱلنَّارِ

data.price: They will say, “Why do we not see those whom we considered to be among the wicked[22]?
data.arabic: وَقَالُواْ مَا لَنَا لَا نَرَىٰ رِجَالٗا كُنَّا نَعُدُّهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَشۡرَارِ
data.footnotes: [22] They are alluding to the believers.

data.price: Is it that we mistakenly made fun of them, or do our eyes fail to see them [in the Fire]?”
data.arabic: أَتَّخَذۡنَٰهُمۡ سِخۡرِيًّا أَمۡ زَاغَتۡ عَنۡهُمُ ٱلۡأَبۡصَٰرُ

data.price: This is certainly true that the people of the Fire will dispute among themselves.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ لَحَقّٞ تَخَاصُمُ أَهۡلِ ٱلنَّارِ

data.price: Say [O Prophet], “I am only a warner, and none has the right to be worshiped except Allah, the One, the Subjugator,
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ مُنذِرٞۖ وَمَا مِنۡ إِلَٰهٍ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡوَٰحِدُ ٱلۡقَهَّارُ

data.price: Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, the All-Mighty[23], Most Forgiving[24].”
data.arabic: رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡغَفَّٰرُ
data.footnotes:
[23] Honored for absolute power, wisdom, and justice.
 [24] Who repeatedly conceals the sins of His slaves.

data.price: Say, “This [Qur’an] is of momentous news
data.arabic: قُلۡ هُوَ نَبَؤٌاْ عَظِيمٌ

data.price: from which you are turning away.”
data.arabic: أَنتُمۡ عَنۡهُ مُعۡرِضُونَ

data.price: [And say], “I had no knowledge of the highest assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [about Adam][25].
data.arabic: مَا كَانَ لِيَ مِنۡ عِلۡمِۭ بِٱلۡمَلَإِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰٓ إِذۡ يَخۡتَصِمُونَ
data.footnotes: [25] When the angels obeyed Allah’s command to prostrate before Adam; whereas, Satan refused to comply, for he considered himself superior to Adam, neglecting the fact that this was a command from Allah Almighty.

data.price: I have only received revelation in order to give a clear warning.”
data.arabic: إِن يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَيَّ إِلَّآ أَنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٌ

data.price: [Remember] when your Lord said to the angels, “I am going to create a human being from clay.
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ إِنِّي خَٰلِقُۢ بَشَرٗا مِّن طِينٖ

data.price: When I completed his creation and breathed into him of My spirit[26], fall down in prostration to him.”
data.arabic: فَإِذَا سَوَّيۡتُهُۥ وَنَفَخۡتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِي فَقَعُواْ لَهُۥ سَٰجِدِينَ
data.footnotes: [26] See footnote 15:29.

data.price: Then the angels fell down in prostration all together,
data.arabic: فَسَجَدَ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ كُلُّهُمۡ أَجۡمَعُونَ

data.price: except Iblīs, who was arrogant and became one of the disbelievers[27].
data.arabic: إِلَّآ إِبۡلِيسَ ٱسۡتَكۡبَرَ وَكَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [27] This command of Allah to bow down before Adam was a test of obedience. Satan refused to comply out of arrogance for he thought he was better than Adam.

data.price: [Allah] said, “O Iblīs, what prevented you from prostrating to whom I created with My two Hands? Did you just become proud or have you always been arrogant?”
data.arabic: قَالَ يَٰٓإِبۡلِيسُ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَن تَسۡجُدَ لِمَا خَلَقۡتُ بِيَدَيَّۖ أَسۡتَكۡبَرۡتَ أَمۡ كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡعَالِينَ

data.price: He said, “I am better than him: You created me from fire and created him from clay.”
data.arabic: قَالَ أَنَا۠ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡهُ خَلَقۡتَنِي مِن نَّارٖ وَخَلَقۡتَهُۥ مِن طِينٖ

data.price: [Allah] said, “Then get out of here, for you are accursed,
data.arabic: قَالَ فَٱخۡرُجۡ مِنۡهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٞ

data.price: and My curse will be upon you until the Day of Judgment.”
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيۡكَ لَعۡنَتِيٓ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: He said, “My Lord, then give me respite until the Day of their resurrection.”
data.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرۡنِيٓ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ يُبۡعَثُونَ

data.price: Allah said, “You are given respite,
data.arabic: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُنظَرِينَ

data.price: until the Day of the appointed time.”
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلۡوَقۡتِ ٱلۡمَعۡلُومِ

data.price: Iblīs said, “By Your Glory, I will surely mislead them all,
data.arabic: قَالَ فَبِعِزَّتِكَ لَأُغۡوِيَنَّهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ

data.price: except for Your chosen slaves among them.”
data.arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنۡهُمُ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ

data.price: Allah said, “Such is the truth – and I only say the truth –
data.arabic: قَالَ فَٱلۡحَقُّ وَٱلۡحَقَّ أَقُولُ

data.price: that I will certainly fill Hell with you and those of them who follow you all together.”
data.arabic: لَأَمۡلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكَ وَمِمَّن تَبِعَكَ مِنۡهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ

data.price: Say [O Prophet], “I do not ask you for any reward for it, nor do I pretend to be what I am not.
data.arabic: قُلۡ مَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٖ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلۡمُتَكَلِّفِينَ

data.price: It is only a reminder for all people[28].
data.arabic: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرٞ لِّلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
data.footnotes: [28] Of jinn and men.

data.price: And you will surely know its truth after a while.”
data.arabic: وَلَتَعۡلَمُنَّ نَبَأَهُۥ بَعۡدَ حِينِۭ

data.price: The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
data.arabic: تَنزِيلُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلۡحَكِيمِ

data.price: Indeed, We have sent down to you [O Prophet] the Book with the truth, so worship Allah with sincere devotion to Him.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَنزَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡكَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ بِٱلۡحَقِّ فَٱعۡبُدِ ٱللَّهَ مُخۡلِصٗا لَّهُ ٱلدِّينَ

data.price: Indeed, sincere devotion is due to Allah alone[1]. As for those who take others as guardians besides Him, [saying], “We only worship them so that they may bring us closer to Allah.” Allah will judge between them[2] concerning that over which they differ. Allah does not guide anyone who is a liar and a persistent disbeliever.
data.arabic: أَلَا لِلَّهِ ٱلدِّينُ ٱلۡخَالِصُۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّخَذُواْ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ أَوۡلِيَآءَ مَا نَعۡبُدُهُمۡ إِلَّا لِيُقَرِّبُونَآ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ زُلۡفَىٰٓ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَحۡكُمُ بَيۡنَهُمۡ فِي مَا هُمۡ فِيهِ يَخۡتَلِفُونَۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهۡدِي مَنۡ هُوَ كَٰذِبٞ كَفَّارٞ
data.footnotes:
[1] i.e., He only accepts sincere worship and obedience.
 [2] i.e., between those who were devoted to Allah alone and those who associated partners with Him.

data.price: If Allah had willed to take for Himself a son, He could have chosen whatever He wished from among what He creates. Glory be to Him. He is Allah, the One, the Subjugator.
data.arabic: لَّوۡ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدٗا لَّٱصۡطَفَىٰ مِمَّا يَخۡلُقُ مَا يَشَآءُۚ سُبۡحَٰنَهُۥۖ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡوَٰحِدُ ٱلۡقَهَّارُ

data.price: He created the heavens and earth for a true purpose. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night. He has subjected the sun and the moon, each running its course for an appointed term. Indeed, He is the All-Mighty, Most Forgiving.
data.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ بِٱلۡحَقِّۖ يُكَوِّرُ ٱلَّيۡلَ عَلَى ٱلنَّهَارِ وَيُكَوِّرُ ٱلنَّهَارَ عَلَى ٱلَّيۡلِۖ وَسَخَّرَ ٱلشَّمۡسَ وَٱلۡقَمَرَۖ كُلّٞ يَجۡرِي لِأَجَلٖ مُّسَمًّىۗ أَلَا هُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡغَفَّٰرُ

data.price: He created you from a single soul[3], then He made from it its mate[4], and He created for you eight types of livestock[5]. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers [in stages], creation after creation, in three layers of darkness[6]. Such is Allah, your Lord. To Him belongs the dominion; none has the right to be worshiped except Him. So how are you averted?
data.arabic: خَلَقَكُم مِّن نَّفۡسٖ وَٰحِدَةٖ ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِنۡهَا زَوۡجَهَا وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَنۡعَٰمِ ثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَزۡوَٰجٖۚ يَخۡلُقُكُمۡ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَٰتِكُمۡ خَلۡقٗا مِّنۢ بَعۡدِ خَلۡقٖ فِي ظُلُمَٰتٖ ثَلَٰثٖۚ ذَٰلِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّكُمۡ لَهُ ٱلۡمُلۡكُۖ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُصۡرَفُونَ
data.footnotes:
[3] i.e., Adam. [4] i.e., Eve. [5] The eight types of livestock: (four males and females): a pair of sheep, a pair of goats, a pair of camels, and a pair of oxen. See 6:143-144.
 [6] These three layers: the belly, the womb, and the amniotic membrane.

data.price: If you disbelieve, then Allah is in no need of you, but He does not approve of disbelief for His slaves. If you are grateful, He approves that for you. No bearer of burden can bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you of what you used to do. He is All-Knowing of what is in the hearts.
data.arabic: إِن تَكۡفُرُواْ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَنِيٌّ عَنكُمۡۖ وَلَا يَرۡضَىٰ لِعِبَادِهِ ٱلۡكُفۡرَۖ وَإِن تَشۡكُرُواْ يَرۡضَهُ لَكُمۡۗ وَلَا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٞ وِزۡرَ أُخۡرَىٰۚ ثُمَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُم مَّرۡجِعُكُمۡ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَۚ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمُۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ

data.price: When adversity befalls man, he calls upon his Lord, turning to Him in repentance. Then when his Lord bestows His favor upon him, he forgets the adversity for which he was calling upon Him before, and sets up rivals to Allah, to mislead others from His way. Say [O Prophet], “Enjoy your disbelief for a little while; you will be one of the people of the Fire.”
data.arabic: ۞ وَإِذَا مَسَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ ضُرّٞ دَعَا رَبَّهُۥ مُنِيبًا إِلَيۡهِ ثُمَّ إِذَا خَوَّلَهُۥ نِعۡمَةٗ مِّنۡهُ نَسِيَ مَا كَانَ يَدۡعُوٓاْ إِلَيۡهِ مِن قَبۡلُ وَجَعَلَ لِلَّهِ أَندَادٗا لِّيُضِلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦۚ قُلۡ تَمَتَّعۡ بِكُفۡرِكَ قَلِيلًا إِنَّكَ مِنۡ أَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلنَّارِ

data.price: [Is he better] or the one who constantly worships during the night, prostrating and standing, fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord? Say, “Are those who know equal to those who do not know?” It is only the people of understanding who will take heed.
data.arabic: أَمَّنۡ هُوَ قَٰنِتٌ ءَانَآءَ ٱلَّيۡلِ سَاجِدٗا وَقَآئِمٗا يَحۡذَرُ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةَ وَيَرۡجُواْ رَحۡمَةَ رَبِّهِۦۗ قُلۡ هَلۡ يَسۡتَوِي ٱلَّذِينَ يَعۡلَمُونَ وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَۗ إِنَّمَا يَتَذَكَّرُ أُوْلُواْ ٱلۡأَلۡبَٰبِ

data.price: Say[7], “O My slaves who believe, fear your Lord. Those who do good in this world will have a good return, and Allah’s earth is spacious. Those who observe patience will be given their reward without measure.”
data.arabic: قُلۡ يَٰعِبَادِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ ٱتَّقُواْ رَبَّكُمۡۚ لِلَّذِينَ أَحۡسَنُواْ فِي هَٰذِهِ ٱلدُّنۡيَا حَسَنَةٞۗ وَأَرۡضُ ٱللَّهِ وَٰسِعَةٌۗ إِنَّمَا يُوَفَّى ٱلصَّٰبِرُونَ أَجۡرَهُم بِغَيۡرِ حِسَابٖ
data.footnotes: [7] Allah instructed the Prophet (ﷺ) to say on behalf of Him.

data.price: Say, “I have been commanded to worship Allah, with sincere devotion to Him,
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنِّيٓ أُمِرۡتُ أَنۡ أَعۡبُدَ ٱللَّهَ مُخۡلِصٗا لَّهُ ٱلدِّينَ

data.price: and I have been commanded to be the first of those who submit to Allah.”
data.arabic: وَأُمِرۡتُ لِأَنۡ أَكُونَ أَوَّلَ ٱلۡمُسۡلِمِينَ

data.price: Say, “I truly fear, if I were to disobey my Lord, the punishment of a momentous Day.”
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ إِنۡ عَصَيۡتُ رَبِّي عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ

data.price: Say, “It is Allah alone Whom I worship, with sincere devotion to Him.
data.arabic: قُلِ ٱللَّهَ أَعۡبُدُ مُخۡلِصٗا لَّهُۥ دِينِي

data.price: So worship whatever you wish besides Him.” Say, “Indeed, the losers are those who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. That is indeed the clear loss.”
data.arabic: فَٱعۡبُدُواْ مَا شِئۡتُم مِّن دُونِهِۦۗ قُلۡ إِنَّ ٱلۡخَٰسِرِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ خَسِرُوٓاْ أَنفُسَهُمۡ وَأَهۡلِيهِمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِۗ أَلَا ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلۡخُسۡرَانُ ٱلۡمُبِينُ

data.price: They will have layers of fire above them and below them. That is how Allah threatens His slaves. Then fear Me, O My slaves!
data.arabic: لَهُم مِّن فَوۡقِهِمۡ ظُلَلٞ مِّنَ ٱلنَّارِ وَمِن تَحۡتِهِمۡ ظُلَلٞۚ ذَٰلِكَ يُخَوِّفُ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦ عِبَادَهُۥۚ يَٰعِبَادِ فَٱتَّقُونِ

data.price: But those who shun the worship of false gods[8] and penitently turn to Allah, there are glad tidings for them. So give glad tidings to My slaves,
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ٱجۡتَنَبُواْ ٱلطَّٰغُوتَ أَن يَعۡبُدُوهَا وَأَنَابُوٓاْ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ لَهُمُ ٱلۡبُشۡرَىٰۚ فَبَشِّرۡ عِبَادِ
data.footnotes: [8] Tāghūt: Satan or any false objects of worship.

data.price: those who listen to speech[9] and follow the best of it. They are the ones whom Allah has guided, and they are the people of understanding.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَسۡتَمِعُونَ ٱلۡقَوۡلَ فَيَتَّبِعُونَ أَحۡسَنَهُۥٓۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ هَدَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُۖ وَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمۡ أُوْلُواْ ٱلۡأَلۡبَٰبِ
data.footnotes: [9] i.e. the Qur’an or another speech, then follow the best option, such as opting for forgiveness instead of retaliation.

data.price: Can you save those against whom the decree of punishment has been passed to be in the Fire?
data.arabic: أَفَمَنۡ حَقَّ عَلَيۡهِ كَلِمَةُ ٱلۡعَذَابِ أَفَأَنتَ تُنقِذُ مَن فِي ٱلنَّارِ

data.price: But those who fear their Lord will have lofty mansions[10], built one above another, under which rivers flow. This is the promise of Allah; Allah never breaks His promise.
data.arabic: لَٰكِنِ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوۡاْ رَبَّهُمۡ لَهُمۡ غُرَفٞ مِّن فَوۡقِهَا غُرَفٞ مَّبۡنِيَّةٞ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُۖ وَعۡدَ ٱللَّهِ لَا يُخۡلِفُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡمِيعَادَ
data.footnotes: [10] i.e., elevated dwellings or palaces.

data.price: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky and makes it flow as springs in the earth, then He brings forth thereby crops of various colors; then they whither and you see them turn yellow; then He causes them to crumble? Indeed, there is a reminder in this for people of understanding.
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءٗ فَسَلَكَهُۥ يَنَٰبِيعَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ ثُمَّ يُخۡرِجُ بِهِۦ زَرۡعٗا مُّخۡتَلِفًا أَلۡوَٰنُهُۥ ثُمَّ يَهِيجُ فَتَرَىٰهُ مُصۡفَرّٗا ثُمَّ يَجۡعَلُهُۥ حُطَٰمًاۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكۡرَىٰ لِأُوْلِي ٱلۡأَلۡبَٰبِ

data.price: Is one whose heart Allah has opened to Islam, so he is enlightened by his Lord [like a disbeliever]? Woe to those whose hearts are hardened upon hearing the reminder of Allah; it is they who are clearly misguided.
data.arabic: أَفَمَن شَرَحَ ٱللَّهُ صَدۡرَهُۥ لِلۡإِسۡلَٰمِ فَهُوَ عَلَىٰ نُورٖ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦۚ فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلۡقَٰسِيَةِ قُلُوبُهُم مِّن ذِكۡرِ ٱللَّهِۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ فِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٍ

data.price: Allah has sent down the best message – a consistent Book of repeated lessons – causing the skins of those who fear their Lord to shiver, and then their skins and their hearts soften at the remembrance of Allah. This is the guidance of Allah by which He guides whom He wills. But whoever Allah causes to stray, there is none to guide him.
data.arabic: ٱللَّهُ نَزَّلَ أَحۡسَنَ ٱلۡحَدِيثِ كِتَٰبٗا مُّتَشَٰبِهٗا مَّثَانِيَ تَقۡشَعِرُّ مِنۡهُ جُلُودُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَخۡشَوۡنَ رَبَّهُمۡ ثُمَّ تَلِينُ جُلُودُهُمۡ وَقُلُوبُهُمۡ إِلَىٰ ذِكۡرِ ٱللَّهِۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُدَى ٱللَّهِ يَهۡدِي بِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَمَن يُضۡلِلِ ٱللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُۥ مِنۡ هَادٍ

data.price: Is one who will shield himself from the terrible punishment with his face[11] on the Day of Resurrection [like someone in Paradise]? And it will be said to the wrongdoers: “Taste what you used to earn.”
data.arabic: أَفَمَن يَتَّقِي بِوَجۡهِهِۦ سُوٓءَ ٱلۡعَذَابِ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِۚ وَقِيلَ لِلظَّٰلِمِينَ ذُوقُواْ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَكۡسِبُونَ
data.footnotes: [11] Rather than his hands, for his hands and feet will be chained to his neck.

data.price: Those who came before them also disbelieved, so the punishment came upon them from where they could not imagine.
data.arabic: كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡ فَأَتَىٰهُمُ ٱلۡعَذَابُ مِنۡ حَيۡثُ لَا يَشۡعُرُونَ

data.price: Therefore Allah gave them a taste of disgrace in the life of this world, but the punishment of the Hereafter will be far greater, if only they knew.
data.arabic: فَأَذَاقَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡخِزۡيَ فِي ٱلۡحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنۡيَاۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ أَكۡبَرُۚ لَوۡ كَانُواْ يَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: Indeed, We have presented for mankind all kinds of examples in this Qur’an, so that they may take heed –
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ ضَرَبۡنَا لِلنَّاسِ فِي هَٰذَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٖ لَّعَلَّهُمۡ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ

data.price: an Arabic Qur’an, free of flaws and contradictions, so that they may be conscious of Allah.
data.arabic: قُرۡءَانًا عَرَبِيًّا غَيۡرَ ذِي عِوَجٖ لَّعَلَّهُمۡ يَتَّقُونَ

data.price: Allah makes a comparison of a slave owned by several quarrelsome masters, and a slave owned by only one master. Are they equal in comparison? All praise be to Allah. But most of them do not know.
data.arabic: ضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلٗا رَّجُلٗا فِيهِ شُرَكَآءُ مُتَشَٰكِسُونَ وَرَجُلٗا سَلَمٗا لِّرَجُلٍ هَلۡ يَسۡتَوِيَانِ مَثَلًاۚ ٱلۡحَمۡدُ لِلَّهِۚ بَلۡ أَكۡثَرُهُمۡ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: You [O Prophet] will surely die, and they too will die;
data.arabic: إِنَّكَ مَيِّتٞ وَإِنَّهُم مَّيِّتُونَ

data.price: then on the Day of Resurrection, you will dispute with one another before your Lord.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ عِندَ رَبِّكُمۡ تَخۡتَصِمُونَ
